introduction.section1: East Malaysia is located in the north of the island of Borneo. It is made up of two states, Sabah and Sarawak.
introduction.section2: Wild landscapes and jungles still exist despite excessive deforestation. The forests, mountains, and rivers of Borneo are home to wild or rehabilitated animals such as elephants, orangutans, or proboscis monkeys. Many of these animals are endemic to this island.
introduction.section3: Find out our travelogue followed by our detailed visits.

title: East Malaysia
meta-description: Wild landscapes and jungles still exist despite excessive deforestation. The forests, mountains, and rivers of Borneo are home to wild or rehabilitated animals such as elephants, orangutans, or proboscis monkeys. Many of these animals are endemic to this island. Through our articles, discover different places to visit. Our travelogue with photos, tips, and advice.
